page.title: 15TRANSPORT AND ROADS,SELSEY
page.content: One Monday morning in June between 9.24 and 9.54 we counted 95 vehicles coming into ,and 139 leaving Selsey. There are 29{bus journeys}to Selsey and 28 to Chichester on weekdays,about one every half hour.It costs{Â£1.60 {return}to Chichester from Selsey, Â£1.10 single. In early May 1985,497 annual{bus passes,}costing Â£7 each, were bought by Selsey pensioners. This allows them to travel on the bus half price. The bus terminus for most journeys is at the junction of Hillfield Road and Seal Road but some daytime journeys in the summer start from West Sands Caravan Park. There are still several{unmade {roads.}Each year a few more are paved,and the residents have to pay.The main street is being resurfaced and levelled outside the summer season.
